intro: Leucopogon foliosus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heather plants. This species is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal heathlands and is well adapted to coastal conditions. Leucopogon foliosus is an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
